annotation.TEXT: Nearly every boss in this game can be put into an unshakable kill-cycle with their weaknesses. With the exception of a distinct few, it pretty much makes these fights complete jokes when you know how to apply these weaknesses (some of which thankfully require more than just standing in one spot while firing the weapon, but it's still pretty bad).

The head upgrade in this game is probably the first truly useful helmet-based upgrade in the series, along with being one of the most broken at the same time. It essentially gives you unlimited weapon energy. The only way your weapons will ever deplete is if you use their charged up versions via the buster upgrade.

I don't know how I initially messed up on getting this heart tank. Either way though, it gave me the chance to try to get it without the crumbling section of the room (or the Lightning Web, for that matter).

Interesting to note, I don't really recall this thing ever targeting other platforms if you try to lure it over a gap by hovering (or double jumping). For that matter, I've never even seen what it does should it break all of the platforms either.

Aiming Laser does all kinds of things wrong. Aside from having an initial range that you have to toggle with in order to even start up the weapon, its damage output is still incredibly low. While you can target multiple enemies at the same time, it doesn't help that the laser itself becomes ineffective if either your target happens to scroll off-screen or if you get hit (which in the latter case, the laser is canceled out altogether).

Interestingly enough, this game actually has two buster upgrades. The first one lets you store up to 4 fully charged shots, letting you fire them off consecutively afterwards. The other one gives you the plasma shot, which basically tears through nearly everything in the game, along with leaving behind an aura that continues to deal damage after hitting something. I personally prefer the plasma shot, since it's essentially the strongest thing in-game aside from the Nova Strike. While it doesn't work too well on bosses, the weapons have that area covered for the most part.

Double Cyclone suffers from more of a range problem than it does with damage output. Aside from traveling at an inconvenient angle, it also has limited range. Its charged ability fixes this tremendously, but by that point, it's still quicker just to use the Plasma Shot.

Split Mushroom is actually a rather interesting boss, provided you don't do what I did here. While I still think X's weapon set in this game is one of the weakest in the series, that doesn't mean they don't have their uses. Against most normal enemies, they're horribly ineffective. When used against bosses, however...

Soul Body is decent enough in concept and functionality. The only problem is that its damage output isn't really that good. It works well in Cyber Peacock's stage and in a few other areas, but beyond that, it doesn't really come in handy that often.
